active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group debate, argue for or against implementing a strict zero-trust model versus a whitelist-only approach for port and protocol restrictions on database servers. Use real-world examples like SQL Server (port 1433) breaches to support your position and reference CIS Control 9 sub-controls.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in 'Port and Protocol Restrictions' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Data Security Controls > Database Security Controls > Database Hardening > Port and Protocol Restrictions). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning activities, 4-layer scaffolding, and flashcard schema to create optimized Anki-style flashcards. Incorporate pedagogy: Bloom's Taxonomy progression, active learning hooks (e.g., reference port scanning debates), scaffolding from basics to integration. Ground in research: Core concepts (ports/protocols/services), CIS Control 9 sub-controls (9.1-9.4), NIST SP 800-41 (port filtering), DB examples (1433 SQL, 3306 MySQL, 3389 RDP, TLS enforcement). Concept map integration in explanations. Generate 75 flashcards strictly following the flashcard schema. Balance: 20% Layer 1, 25% Layer 2, 30% Layer 3, 25% Layer 4; span all Bloom's levels per objectives. Output as JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'distractors_protocol_applied': '[if MC]', 'active_recall_prompt': '...', 'metadata': {...}}}, ...]. Ensure distractors are educationally valuable. No duplicates; high fidelity to voter consensus (82.9% approval).
